page.title: 06WARGRAVE 2000 COMMITTEE
page.content:
In 1984, at the Parish Assembly, a committee was appointed to consider village needs in the year {2000}. Elected were{Philip Emerton}as chairman,{Keith Hurley} as secretary, and five other members.
The committee talked to people from the Parish, District and County Councils , the Vicar and headmaster of the senior school. They contacted sports clubs and examined amenities controlled by the Church and Council. Information was taken from the 1981 census and a survey of residents.
The committee reported that most people want the village to remain much as it is now, and they recommended that any additional sports facilities should be funded by the users.
